subject: Re: [junit] Dynamic Casting of HomeInterface
msgSnippet: Is there no way you can set up an (abstract ?) base class, and cast to that? If you re casting to a radically different set of classes I d wonder about the
messageBody:
Is there no way you can set up an (abstract ?) base class, and cast to
that? If you're casting to a radically different set of classes I'd wonder
about the implementation/design...

(And sorry, I can't think of any way to do dynamic casting - no doubt by
playing with java.lang.reflect.* you could find something, but it's not
anything I've ever needed to do...)


Jim
